Es un muy muy pero muy buen juego, no me canso de jugarlo, me encanta el ambiente que tiene, los eventos, los asesinos, los personajes, la variedad de perks que hay y lo que realmente importa no es ganar, es jugar bien, si jug√°s bien ganes o pierdas vas a tener muchos puntos, lo que te hace subir de elo y conseguir nuevas cosas. Te entretiene much√≠simo y ya seas main killer, main survi, o los dos, te vas a divertir completamente. A mi en especial no me molesta ni me disgusta jugar solo, pero con amigos es mucho m√°s f√°cil y divertido. Las mec√°nicas, los gr√°ficos, la jugabilidad, y el entretenimiento que trae este juego lo hacen incre√≠ble. Lo √∫nico que hay que tener es cuidado con los requisitos, porque este juego requiere mucho y una computadora de gama baja no lo soporta, fuera de eso es una joya.
Completamente recomendado.

I have a lot of hours in this game, so here is my review...
I have a love/hate relationship with this game. Matches can often leave you feeling rewarded and happy or disappointed and exhausted. I have had days where I can play a whole day but then other days i can't stand the sight of the game. I definitely suggest taking breaks from this game. The game has regular updates which is a bitter sweet thing. The "events" are very rewarding and ties you into the game to get the points and cosmetics but the community can often be very unfair and aggressive and the 20% are fairly kind. All I can say is if you want to play this game, don't be expecting constant matches to be fulfilling and enjoyable.

El juego es muy bueno y divertido pero tiene el problema actual que el equilibrio va tirando en favor de los supervivientes y se necesita habilidad y paciencia para poder jugarlo ya que uno tiene que estar preparado para perder mucho, si lograran arreglar ese problema de equilibrio este juego ganar√≠a mucho

While it can be frustrating at times (as EVERY online multiplayer game), in every other case, it's just a fun experience. The tension of saving your teammate from a deadly killer, or cowering in the bushes as they're carried away, as well as the satisfaction of just LANDING that attack on a survivor that's been bugging you all game, it all makes for a well rounded experience. 
Of course there's the grinding as well, and the luck-based leveling system could use a few tweaks, but it's nothing that really turns me off at all. Getting bloodpoints is quite easy, especially on the Killer side with perks like Barbecue & Chilli (or Distressing if you really want those BP), along with seasonal Codes to redeem, as long as you just [i] play the game [/i], I personally don't really feel the need to "grind". 
The fact that licensed characters are only attainable with real money is... an interesting decision, but one I don't mind too much. There are plenty of sales for various occasions, and if you've really set your eye on one, it doesn't tear a huge hole in your wallet, with 1.75$ for one character on the cheapest occasion. The only other purchasable thing in the game are cosmetics, which are completely optional of course. 
Non-licensed characters, by the way, can also be earned in-game with Shards, a currency that comes with collecting XP. So the more you play the game, the more characters you'll be able to get for yourself anyway. Aside that, you can use those Shards for the "Shrine of Secrets", which contains perks from every character and changes every week. This way, you can save yourself from buying a whole character just for their perk, by instead waiting for it to appear there for a much cheaper price.
Lastly, the matchmaking is fine for the most part. I can't deny it's weird that there are many teams with 2 complete beginners, and 2 "pro survivors", but I don't know if that's a universal experience. Once you've really settled with the MMR, and the game knows where your skill is at, you get placed with others of similar skill most of the time. 
So in the end, I'd recommend this game!

Es ist sehr anstrengend und meine geistliche Gesundheit schwankt beim spielen. Wenn du ein Spiel willst, wo du nicht mit Randoms spielen kannst, dann kauf es dir. Eine Survivor-Runde lohnt sich nur mit mindestens 2 Freunden. Die Killer sind ekelhafte Schwitzer und g√∂nnen dir garnix. Wenn du neu Startest, hast du ein riesiges Problem, den Rang aufzusteigen. Jedes Update und neue Feature versaut/zerst√∂rt dieses Spiel immer mehr. Das angek√ºndigte Ringu DLC ist absolute Schei√üe. Das Spiel hat seinen Vibe verloren, durch das Versagen der Entwickler!!!
